DOC.brief_summary: Subjects receive medical treatment ovarian cancer physically emotionally demand patient . The purpose study determine whether two common pyschological intervention ( Communication Skills Intervention Supportive Counseling ) may improve well-being ovarian cancer patient compare usual care .
DOC.detailed_description: Very little known psycho-oncology literature psychological intervention effective long intervention exert impact . Given many cancer patient experience recurrence and/or progression , important know whether relatively brief intervention facilitate patient cope most-feared medical event . From theoretical perspective , study advance understanding mechanism change two common treatment approach , supportive cognitive behavioral therapy . Subjects enrol upon completion baseline survey , randomize one three arm - Communication Skills Intervention , Supportive Counseling , Usual Care . Subjects complete survey course intervention .
DOC.criteria: Newly diagnose stage primary ovarian cancer , primary peritoneal cancer , primary fallopian tube cancer past 6 month Newly diagnose High Grade Stage 2 , grade Stage 3 high endometrial cancer past 6 month Newly diagnose Stage 2 high cervical cancer withing past 6 month Newly diagnose stage Uterine cancer ( sarcoma carcinosarcoma ) past 6 month At time recruitment , patient active treatment define either currently receive chemotherapy radiation le 6 month postcancer surgery At time recruitment , Karnofsky Performance Status 80 Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group ( ECOG ) score 0 1 English speaking Lives within twohour commute distance recruitment site No hearing impairment Has sign consent within 6 month diagnosis date
